pests.name: Kitchen Cockroach
pests.description: The classic urban invader. Brown, fast, and hides in damp places.
pests.danger: Contaminates food and is disgusting. If it flies, it causes general panic.
pests.solution: Aerosol insecticide and a grandma's slipper.

pests.name: Delta Mosquito
pests.description: Flying insect that emits an unbearable buzz when trying to sleep.
pests.danger: Transmits Dengue and ruins the BBQ.
pests.solution: Coils, repellent, and emptying water containers.

pests.name: Suburban Mouse
pests.description: Small grey rodent. Leaves circular droppings and gnaws on power cables.
pests.danger: Can transmit Hantavirus and eat your savings.
pests.solution: Glue traps or adopting a stray cat.

pests.name: Pruning Ant
pests.description: Black ants walking in single file carrying leaves.
pests.danger: They leave the rose bush bare in one night.
pests.solution: Broken rice or granular bait near the anthill.

pests.name: Kissing Bug (Vinchuca)
pests.description: Large bug with yellow or orange stripes on the side.
pests.solution: Do not squash (spreads the parasite). Capture in a jar and call professional fumigation.

pests.name: The Pombero
pests.description: Goblin from the littoral, short and hairy. Announces himself with a sharp whistle.
pests.danger: Kidnaps children at siesta time and impregnates single women. Touches people with cold hands.
pests.solution: Leave offerings of tobacco, honey, and cane liquor outside the house to befriend him.

pests.name: Mate Goblin
pests.description: Small invisible being that lives in the cupboards.
pests.danger: Washes the mate instantly, hides the bombilla (straw), and spills the sugar.
pests.solution: Leave an open packet of cookies as a distraction.

pests.name: The Chupacabras
pests.description: Creature with spines on its back and glowing red eyes.
pests.danger: Attacks livestock and pets leaving them without a drop of blood.
pests.solution: Install electric fences and powerful lights in the yard.

pests.name: Bad Light (Luz Mala)
pests.description: Phosphorescent lights floating low to the ground in the fields at night.
pests.danger: They represent lost souls. If the light is red, it is a dangerous soul.
pests.solution: Do not look at the light, bite a knife sheath, and pray.

pests.name: The Lobizón (Werewolf)
pests.description: Seventh male son who transforms into a giant black dog during the full moon.
pests.danger: Attacks fiercely if crossed on your path. Howls at the moon.
pests.solution: Only stopped by a blessed bullet, but better to stay locked up until dawn.

pests.name: La Llorona (The Weeping Woman)
pests.description: Specter of a woman dressed in white wandering riverbanks crying for her lost children.
pests.danger: Her cry paralyzes with terror. If you look her in the eyes, she can steal your soul or take you into the water.
pests.solution: Never look at her. Pray and run in the opposite direction of the river. Wear underwear inside out.

pests.name: Garden Gnome
pests.description: Small ceramic statues that come to life at night. They are mischievous and vengeful if mistreated.
pests.danger: They can break things, hide keys, or attack ankles in groups. Very annoying.
pests.solution: Smash them with a hammer before nightfall or gift them to someone you dislike.

pests.name: The Nahuelito
pests.description: Prehistoric creature inhabiting Lake Nahuel Huapi. Similar to a plesiosaur, with a long neck and humps.
pests.danger: Can capsize boats and drag swimmers to the bottom of the lake. Causes sudden giant waves.
pests.solution: Do not sail on foggy days. If you see it, make no noise and move slowly towards the shore.

pests.name: The Familiar
pests.description: Huge black dog with eyes of fire, a manifestation of the devil. Protects sugar mills in exchange for souls.
pests.danger: Feeds on solitary workers. Its bark is an omen of death. Immune to bullets.
pests.solution: Carry a blessed rosary and a dagger with a cross on the hilt. Do not walk alone in the cane fields at night.

pests.name: The Yasy Yateré
pests.description: Beautiful blonde goblin that appears at siesta time. Carries a golden staff and attracts children.
pests.danger: Kidnaps children to play, feeds them honey and fruit, but then abandons them far away or drives them crazy.
pests.solution: Do not sleep siesta outside. If he appears, steal his golden staff so he loses his powers.

calls.message: Hi, how's it going? Leo speaking. Look, I'm here in the yard with the kids and I hear a weird whistling... Anto says she saw something short and hairy near the grill. What do you think it is?
Good evening. It's me, Chiqui. I'm at my estate and I see some lights floating way out there, near the fence. They aren't flashlights, darling, they float. It gives me terrible fright, dammit shit.
Beautiful morning, isn't it! Well, not so much. I went to see my rose bushes and they are bare. Not a single leaf left. I saw a black path on the ground that moves. Can you help me?
Weird! This is weird! I found a bug on the wall, it has orange stripes on the side. My grandma says it's dangerous for the heart. Tell me what it is or I'll have an attack!

Baaabe, hello, yeah? Like... I'm in a total crisis. I went to the kitchen for water and a brown bug ran out super fast. Like, literally, I almost died of disgust! I mean, it went under the fridge and won't come out. Get it out now, it gives me so much anxiety!
Oh honey, listen to me. My whole patio is full of mosquitoes. It's unbearable. What do I do?
Hey kid, I got something in the warehouse. Don't know what it is but they're furry. They're eating my salami. Send me something urgent.
I mean, let's say... I have a stock problem. Leaves from my writings are disappearing. I find little pieces of paper and small black balls. It's an attack on private property!
Hello my love! Listen, there's a huge dog in the garden. But huge! And it walks on two legs, I swear. I thought it was a dinosaur... Alive? I don't know, it's howling.
Hello loves. I have a discount poltergeist in the kitchen. I pour a mate and two seconds later it's washed out. The set shuts up, but the sugar disappears! I am such a 'vistim'.
Eeeeehhhh... hello master. Look, they won't let me sleep siesta. There's a buzzing... zzzzz... that's driving me crazy. They bit my whole ankle. Do something, champ.
Sonny, there is someone in my garden. They move my pots around and I hear mocking giggles. What a cheeky one!
Hic! I saw a little blonde man during siesta. He asked me for an apple and had a golden staff. Should I give it to him?
Hey friend, I saw some weird lights in the field. They float over the bones of dead cows. They say they bring misfortune. What do I do?
Hi, I'm in the forest and I hear whistling. I feel like someone is touching my shoulder but no one is there. I'm scared.
Stop it guys! Mom! You cut all the liiight... Oh no, wait. I see red eyes in the yard and my cats are scared. Miaaami! Do something with that spiny thing!
Dude, that garden gnome... is looking at me funny. Yesterday he was looking north and today he looks south. I didn't touch him. He moves on his own, I swear I didn't take anything weird.
We are concentrating near the river and a woman crying can be heard. She won't let the players rest. She screams 'my chiiildren'. Is this a jinx?
In the lake, I saw a giant shadow underwater. It looked like a snake but with humps. It almost capsized my boat! Do I cast the line or run?
Boss, that black dog is loose again. But it's not a normal dog, it has eyes of fire and drags chains. The workers don't want to go out.
Help! There is a hairy beast in my patio. It walks on four legs but looks like a man.
Sir, I found my goats dead. They are all dry, as if their blood was sucked out. They have two little holes in the neck.
I'm on guard at the river and a terrible wail is heard. A woman dressed in white looking for something... or someone. It freezes my blood.
I was taking photos of the lake and saw something come out of the water! It was huge, with a long neck. It's not a log, it was moving!
The boss's dog looked at me ugly and I got goosebumps. They say if you look into its eyes you die. I'm not going back to the shed.
A phenomenon! The rice worked great. Now yes, now all the ants are there still. Thanks, you saved my rose bush.
I mean, the bug died, yeah. But the smell of poison won't come out of my clothes. Like... I had to throw everything away. Oh, what stress! Anyway thanks, I guess.
Che master, thanks for the tip. We left the tobacco outside and this morning the Pombero was gone. You're a phenomenon. Greetings to the family and I'll call you next time.
No son, no no no no, that wasn't it!
Close everything! They say there is a full moon tonight and the Gomez's seventh son is acting weird. Just in case, I'm not going out.
This is a total disaster! You told me traps and now the rodent escaped and is eating my papers. It's an attack on intellectual property! A sham! The solution is worse than the disease.
... Don't look out the window... the red light is not a car... they already know you are answering...
